text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with another classic recipe from
carnation evaporated milk this is a
loaded potato potluck a great potato
casserole it's got all your favorites on
there you start with two and a half to
three pounds of potatoes peel em cut
them up in equal sized portions very
important if you wanted to cook evenly
they must be equally sized otherwise you
get lumps because some cook and some
don't we're going to boil those in
salted water until tender
mine took about 25 minutes in the
meantime i took six strips of bacon cook
that and crumbled it or chopped it i
also have two cups of grated cheddar and
some optional green onions all right
once the potatoes are cooked and drained
very well drained you don't want watery
potatoes I'm going to mash those with a
cup of carnation evaporated milk half a
cup of sour cream half a teaspoon of
black pepper or to taste teaspoon of
salt and then you're going to mash that
up now you can use an electric mixer if
you want I like to go by hand you know
get some exercise we're going to put in
almost all the cheese save a half cup
for the top so a cup and a half of the
cheese we're going to throw in half of
the crumbled bacon save the other half
for the top and then you can put the
green onions just on top or I like to
put them inside and on top so I'm going
to put in a little bit of the green
onion a couple tablespoons
alright mix that up and then you're
going to take a three quart casserole
dish lightly oiled or buttered you're
going to put in your potatoes I like a
nice irregular top you know I like my
knucks
and I like my crannies so make kind of
an irregular pattern on top that's going
to cook for 25 minutes at 350 degrees
then to finish a little bit of green
onion the rest of our bacon and look at
that piece of bacon I think I'm gonna
eat that yeah you know what a bit or not
I can wait the rest of our cheese and
you're going to pop that back in for
just five minutes just to melt the
cheese a little bit and when it comes
out your loaded potato potluck casserole
is done
and ready to take to a potluck so the
hardest thing about cooking for a
potluck getting invited to one but if
you do this we fantastic so it's like a
beautiful loaded baked potato without
that annoying nutritious fiber rich skip
okay so it's just the inside just the
good stuff no butter no cream it's not
overly fatty except for the cheese and
bacon just a really nice classic old
American recipe from carnation
evaporated milk go to the site where
you'll find all the ingredients as usual
and as always enjoy
